ol.li: Work with (n \times n)-matrices where n \gt 1. Take A to be the matrix with -1 in the (1,1) entry and zeroes everywhere else and B to be the identity matrix. Then \det(A+B)=0. However, \det(A)+\det(B)=1.
We can construct a whole family of such matrices. Let a,b \in \R, then \det(a\mat{1 0;0 1}+b\mat{0 -1;1 0})=a^2 + b^2 = \det(a\mat{1 0; 0 1}) + \det(b\mat{0 -1;1 0}).
